formElement.label: Configuration name:
formElement.documentation: Name of the configuration to be used. URL and credentials are retrieved from the given configuration. To view or create a new configuration, go to the Administration -> Plugins tab, and select 'Configure' action for @PLUGIN_KEY@ plugin.
formElement.htmlDocumentation:
Name of the configuration to be used. URL and credentials are retrieved from the given configuration.
A Configuration defines connection details and can be created by going to plugin configuration page.

formElement.label: Data Source Name:
formElement.documentation: Name of the Data Source. This will also serve as the unique identifier for this resource. For example MySqlDS

formElement.label: JNDI Name:
formElement.documentation: JNDI Name of the Data Source. For example java:/MySqlDS

formElement.label: JDBC Driver Name:
formElement.documentation: Defines the JDBC driver the data source should use. It is a symbolic name matching the name of installed driver. For example mysql

formElement.label: Connection URL:
formElement.documentation: Required for JBoss EAP 6.X, 7.0. Not Required for 7.1. The JDBC driver connection URL. For example jdbc:mysql://localhost:3306/mysqldb

formElement.label: Data Source Connection Credentials:
formElement.documentation: Credential that contains username and password used for the connection (need to be attached to step).

formElement.label: Enabled:
formElement.documentation: If the created Data Source should be enabled or not. Default is true.

formElement.label: Profile:
formElement.documentation: Required for Domain, will be ignored for Standalone. Name of the Server Profile to which this Data Source applies to. For example: 'full', 'full-ha'

formElement.label: Additional Options:
formElement.documentation: 'Additional options' to be passed on to jboss-cli. The parameters mentioned in this string will be concatenated to already generated command line for creating data source. For example: --min-pool-size=5 --max-pool-size=10 --check-valid-connection-sql="select 1 from dual"
